A good opportunity for good photos and historical experiences.

top_reviews.title: Surprise, fun
top_reviews.review: This museum is the first place I visited in Dubai. It's incredible. It gives me a full understanding of Dubai's culture and history, Ms. Xinyan Liu gave us a tour in the Perfume house. She is very professional, explained in details. We really enjoyed with her. Highly recommend this museum.

top_reviews.title: Excellent museum in Dubai! Not to be missed
top_reviews.review: Used to very shiny new things in Dubai, visiting this amazing traditional museum was a delight!! The museum occupies like a whole neighborhood of traditional houses that have been preserved in their architecture and renovated inside to give place to really modern displays, each dedicated to a different theme, all in the service of introducing you to the history, culture and heritage of Dubai and UAE. From the beginning of the tour, our guide, Aisha Al Ameir, was wonderful, very warm, charming and knowledgeable about the museum, the traditions and history. Since there are so many houses with displays and we couldn't cover them all in the hours we were there, she pointed us to the ones she loved the most and we could see why. Also Mohamed Askari was really good in one of the first houses we visited. I would definitely recommend the visit for all tourist, but also to the expatriates living in UAE: the museum tells a compelling tale of the people of this wonderful land. And if you ask for Aisha you'll be sure to have an even better time. The location by the creek makes for some amazing pictures. Don't miss sitting by the water to see the seagulls.

name: The Camel Farm
description: We Are Now Temporary Closed For The Summer. Our Guided Visits Will Start Again By Mid October 2022.

top_reviews.title: Amazing experience!
top_reviews.review: Today we visited the camel farm. It was an amazing experience! The people running the place are very kind and the tour guide knows a lot about the animals. The camel ride was also fun! Worth the visit and not very expensive. Thanks to the entire team on behalf of my husband and I for an amazing experience!!

top_reviews.title: Brilliant experience and service!
top_reviews.review: Had a wonderful experience at the Camel Farm. Whilst I was expecting something slightly bigger, the interaction with the animals as well the information from our guide, Oluchi, made it an unforgettable experience. We took the tour with feeding, which was supposed to last an hour and the time flew by. Oluchi was great at answering all our questions, telling us about the animals' stories, and it was brilliant to be able to hold baby goats and tortoises as well. He took some great pictures for us as well. Whilst it isn't the cheapest thing to do, I felt it was money well spent and would highly recommend a visit.

top_reviews.title: Definitely well worth the visit
top_reviews.review: Loved the Camel farm. Not advertised on tourist map I found it on Arabic tourist map instead. Our lovely guide gave us plants to feed them, aswell as the other farm animals including deer,donkeys,bunnies,large tortoise and birds. I went on the three minute ride which was great. They also do an hour camel ride in the dessert which I would have loved to do but my daughter wasnât keen. Would love to go back again for the hour ride. Closes at 5pm

top_reviews.title: Just brilliant!
top_reviews.review: One of our absolute favourite experiences in the UAE. A genuine delight to visit and help feed all their amazing animals. The kids had a blast and we got to see a one week old camel and cuddle a three week old baby! Did the feeding tour, camel cuddle therapy and a quick ride. Could not recommend more highly!

top_reviews.title: My favourite attraction in Dubai
top_reviews.review: One of the best tourist attractions I have ever visited. Quite easy to drive yourself to - on a brand new highway followed by a mildly thrilling 300m or so across the desert. If you do go the guided tour with animal feeding is well worth paying for. Unencumbered by ideals of conservationism that have reduced many western zoos to quasi museums, here one can really get up close and personal with the animals. Our toddler was able to pick up a baby goat and carry it around. You don't get that at Berlin Zoo. The camels are charming, the staff are charming, and sitting in their tent drinking a cup of tea after the walk was wonderfully peaceful. An absolute must for any family in Dubai.

name: Dubai Creek
description: Separating Deira and Bur Dubai, the creek is the city's historic commercial hub. Explore and cross the canal on a traditional abra boat ride.

top_reviews.title: Abra road
top_reviews.review: A fairly wide channel, crossed by a lot of boats of all kinds, zigzagging between the banks like aquatic insects. In the Bur-Dubai area, the shore is full of restaurants with terraces right on the water's edge. Also, here is the bazaar area, very lively and crowded. I think it is an experience that must be tried.

top_reviews.title: Enjoyed my visit here!
top_reviews.review: After checking it at my hotel in Deira, this was the first attraction I visited i the area. I noted shops and stores as I walked towards the Abra Station where I rode the local boat for 1 AED. The boat ride was short, about 5-7 minutes. There is a Souq or a small market area where one can shop for clothings, spices, nuts, bags & luggages, jewelries, etc. Of course there are small restaurants along the creek and near the Souq. I enjoyed my visit here. Highly recommended to visit here, when you get bored visiting high rise buildings.

top_reviews.title: Where Dubai got started in the 1830s
top_reviews.review: This saltwater creek that leads from the Persian Gulf towards the south landinward is where first human settlement took place in this part of the Arabia. Originally the creek was not very deep and it ended in a swamp (Ras al Khor). Gradually it was deepened and quays were developed along its shores enabling dhows (cargo ships) to dock. Nowadays it is much more "developed". A canal was built in 2016 connecting the once dead-end creek to the sea south of Dubai. Along its shores particularly southwest is the modern city with sky scrapers, but towards the north where it is dividing Bur Dubai and Deira still more traditional harbour activities can be observed. This is definitely the most interesting part of the creek, though few Emiratis still tend to live there. Deira and Bur Dubai feel more like cities on the Indian subcontinent.

top_reviews.title: Dubai Creek is the city's vibrant artery
top_reviews.review: Dubai Creek is a natural seawater inlet divides the city of Dubai into two sections: Deira and Bur Dubai. Today, it boasts modern developments including iconic landmarks like Dubai Creek Tower. The area harmouniously belnds tradition and innovation, offering visitors a unique experince with traditional markets known as souks, and picturesque waterfront showcasing the city commitment to preserving its heritage while embarcing contemporary elements.

top_reviews.title: Awesome
top_reviews.review: It was beautiful. Wish we couldve stayed longer. So much to do so little time. The list of activities is endless. Many accomodation and dining options. Perfect place to have a wide range of experiences in one place.

top_reviews.title: Great to see but pestered non stop !
top_reviews.review: So pleased we visited here to experience a bit of old town Dubai in the Gold & Spice Souks. We were ready to be pestered by the vendors but our experience took things to a whole new level. We were always polite with âno Thank youâ but for some thatâs not enough, they physically grab you or even block you leaving their store if you enter so my advice is to visit if you are confident & know what you want but if you are timid do not go, you will be taken advantage of. Do not shake hands (they donât let go & pull you in), do not try on head scarves âfor a photoâ as it is taken as a gesture to but, etc etcâ¦ Always haggle on price as first price is never best & even âbest priceâ is not lowest ! Again, we wanted to come here & really pleased we did, also make sure you experience the boats across the creek, you pay the driver 1 EAD pp/per trip - !!! We found a nice coffee shop for a break @ also a nice place for ice tea by the creek, quite reasonable prices too

top_reviews.title: Lovely trip to the creek and souks
top_reviews.review: Love the creek and the souks. Great experience for the kids . Itâs one dirhams each to cross the creek on the wooden boats which the kids loved. We went to a lovely restaurant called the real creek ! Food was amazing

top_reviews.title: Picturesque
top_reviews.review: The one dirham boat ride across was an experience, ensure you donât end up on a private crossing as they are much more expensive and unnecessary in my opinion. The guys running the boats are very keen to lead you to a private option. We were not comfortable walking round the vendors on the other side as they were so persistent and determined. So a very short half hour and we went back. The stalls on the main side had a couple selling fresh squeezed juice. Absolutely delicious and very cheap, orange or pomegranate.

top_reviews.title: A must do in Dubai!
top_reviews.review: Love Love Love Dubai! The creek is a must! Like being in the Aladdin film! See the original part though, do a tour with a guide you learn so much! Definitely take an Abra over to the souk. What an experience. Would 100 % return.

top_reviews.title: 66th Birthday in Dubai â¦ a 20-day grand vacation.
top_reviews.review: I have lots of fun with my youngest daughter. Spending my 66th birthday here on board Dhow cruise.at the Creek. It was my unforgettable birthday and for being my first time to visit Dubai. I have a 20 days grand vacation in this luxurious travel destination that is Dubai. Very grateful for the moment in my waning days. Thanks to my daughters for giving me this gift of my lifetime.

top_reviews.title: Great experience
top_reviews.review: First time back for a few years and booked the Invasor Room package. Beautiful restaurant with option to sit outdoors to watch the races. Good selection of both food and drinks. Excellent and friendly service by all of the staff and a special thank you to Shasti for looking after us. Also really enjoyed the live saxophonist.

top_reviews.title: Beware Rogue 'Taxi'
top_reviews.review: We had a wonderful evening at Meydan racecourse. We opted for the Parade Ring Package which was fantastic value, staff were wonderful and the food and choice of drinks excellent. Now to the downside. We took an Uber there from our hotel with no issues, price 110AED, when leaving the racecourse we joined the taxi queue. Looked very official. We got in the taxi and I noticed that it did not have a meter. The driver said it would be 460AED how would I like to pay, I said I wouldn't and got out. No signal so couldn't call an Uber and not a single official taxi anywhere. A long line of people waiting for cabs, I eventually negotiated 140AED. It felt very uncomfortable and I was very glad to arrive back safely. It is a shame that the official taxi situation isn't addressed.

top_reviews.title: Fun visit
top_reviews.review: It was a very fascinating experience, as it was a first time for us. We had no clue what to expect- but the 5AED price of ticket booked online was worth every penny. They had 6-7 races on the day we went. At the entrance you are given a booklet with the horse details for each race, and a card on which you make your guess and mark the winning horses for each race. Since we were confused we asked around, and were given all the help we needed. It's a unique experience for sure. Pro tip: if you don't like crowds- beware, or buy more expensive tickets. But we found the crowds friendly and helpful.

top_reviews.title: Meydan Racecourse First Class, definitely worth the visit
top_reviews.review: Meydan Racecourse was on our bucket list, it was well worth the wait. Itâs an amazing venue . We splashed out in a Paddock View with buffet dinner. Everything was first class. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, ambiance was lovely. We chose Paddock View, which has its own outside seating areas and holds around 25/30 people, food service was open and completely stocked up until the end of racing which was after 10pm, excellent selection, very tasty and well presented. Lovely guy beautifully playing a very fancy violin type instrument, Made to feel very welcome, Thank you everyone for such. Brilliant evening

name: Quranic Park
description: Quranic Park is a pioneering modern, cultural project that emerges from the cultural and scientific achievements of Islam, a wonderful opportunity to explain many wonderful meanings and miracles that the Holy Quran contains in the scientific and medical fields. The Park is open daily, kindly check the operational hours before taking the trip as it changes frequently on National and Public Holidays. Jogging area is open 24 hours. Park entrance is free of charge, however there is fee for two attractions: ticket price is AED 10 for entrance to the Cave of the Miracles (AED 5) and Glass House (AED 5) located inside the Quranic Park. Kids below three years of age, people of determination enter for free. Customers can use RTA NOL card, also recharge it inside the Park. Public transportation to Quranic Park E66, X23, X123 as well as public taxis are available right the entrance gate of Quranic Park.

top_reviews.title: Most Amazing experience
top_reviews.review: It was one of the best places we have visited as a Muslim family in Dubai. The miracle cave videos were very educational and the guide asked us multiple questions throughout that made the experience even more exciting for our four children. We then proceeded to the glass house and what an experience that was. Our guide Abdul Kareem was excellent. He gave us a guided tour of all the plants, asked us multiple questions, told us the characteristics of each plant or fruit and made us reflect on those characteristics and how it relates to us in our day to day lives. Abdul Kareem also made us reflect on our own Quranic knowledge and ayahs in the Quran that we related to most. Itâs definitely worth a visit for Muslims and non Muslims alike and us as a family of 6 with4 children aged between 7-12 years thoroughly enjoyed it. We ended up spending over 3 hours here when originally thinking we would be done in one. Absolutely loved it and if you get to have a tour of the glass house with Abdul Kareem go for it!!

top_reviews.title: Tour guide at glass house Quranic Park
top_reviews.review: I had a chance to visit the Quranic Park. It was an extreme experience. If you ever plan to visit. Go to the Glass House and ask for Brother Hakeem (or other staff members) for tours. He will talk about fruits and vegetables (plants) the meaning behind why it was created that way and the benefits etc.

top_reviews.title: Peaceful Park
top_reviews.review: Really beautiful park. I had the pleasure of meeting Abdul, who kindly showed me around the park and spoke in depth about the significance of the plants within the park. I was even kindly gifted a Quran which was really nice. The park itself is huge; amazing for families. I would definitely go back there again.

top_reviews.title: Phenomenal, informative & enlightening
top_reviews.review: Delightful and most informative visit to the Glass House Quranic park. Mr Abdul Hakim had us spell bound as he spoke about 19 of the 51 plants and trees, their benefits and significance as mentioned in Al Quran and Al Sunnah. 3 hours well spent.

top_reviews.title: Thought provoking
top_reviews.review: The Quran was brought to life in the Glass House by Abdul Hakeem. His âquestion was which plant are you?â He then went on to capture our audience by describing the qualities of a the plants and likening them to characteristics of a human and society The date palm tree was likened to a friend who stands tall and gives. The olive tree is humble, resilient and giving. The watermelon which is strong but also tender and sweet. The Basil gives easily and without effort. The pomegranate was likened to a family - the crown the father , the peel the mum and the jewels within children - but the reason this unit works is because of the boundaries( thin but there to ensure you are close but still have space. He referred back to verses of the Quran and narrated stories of our beloved prophet.

top_reviews.title: Peaceful Park
top_reviews.review: Beautiful glass house..where you can learn about plants in Quran and hadits...with clear explanation from our guide Ahmad Shaleh from Sudan. Unfortunately when we came the lake was under reconstruction. But still we could enjoy the serenity of the park.

top_reviews.title: Amazing experience with family in Quranic Park Dubai
top_reviews.review: We visited this amazing place on our trip to Dubai.We brought our little daughter with us, and had a full tour of the place. It gives an exceptional experience and deeper understanding of our Holy Quran. I was pleasantly surprised of knowledge of guides, they are young but all the questions we asked during the tour in Cave, our guide (his name tag said Shahbaz Khan), was able to answer in depth and made our experience richer. The Glass house with the plants interested our baby a lot, she was just looking aroud in amusement. And we enjoyed the natural beaty of the place overall. Definitely will visit once again and will tell our friends who will be visiting Dubai not to miss this beautiful place.

top_reviews.title: Quran Park Greenhouse Tour
top_reviews.review: Had a really lovely day out with the family! We joint the tour given by Abdul Haqeem. He gave an excellent tour with Islamic stories that he related to the fruits and vegetables in the exhibition. Will definitely be recommending to our family/friends!

top_reviews.title: Knowledgeable and counseling
top_reviews.review: Had a wonderful time and managed to discover my personality better and learned on how to relate it with a plant. I learned that I can introduce myself as a date palm-tree cause it's a sign of generosity and hospitality. Thanks to the guide in a white dress for he explained it well and related it to the Quran and social life. It's worthy visiting

top_reviews.title: Beautiful â¤ï¸
top_reviews.review: Such a beautiful place with Mr Abdul Hakim explaining each and every plants about their pros and cons. All the plants and fruits that were mentioned in the Quran. Itâs a must to visit here. For my personality is Onion and Cucumber. Ahmad was also guiding the path and was friendly to us. Highly recommend ðð½ðð½ðð½

name: OliOli
description: OliOliÂ® - The must-visit world-class childrenâs museum OliOliÂ® is the Hawaiian word for 'joy' and entails 8 galleries with over 45 interactive exhibits. Lovingly designed and inspired by ideas of educators, artists, development psychologists and museum experts from 12 countries, OliOliÂ® offers children the ability to engage in open-ended and non-judgmental play, learn to take risks in low-stakes environments, use their hands to make things and problem-solve, gain fascination with STEAM in a joyful manner â and most importantly, play and bond with their families. Come, explore, be curious, discovery, find joy!

top_reviews.title: OliOli visit!
top_reviews.review: We had such a fab experience at Oli Oli, My kids had an amazing time and they were completely entertained! It was fun and educational! The Magical Winterland was beautiful and it got us into the festive spirit! This Childrenâs play museum is a must visit!

top_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
top_reviews.review: Such an amazing experience, everything is planned and thought out beforehand, and I did not have to worry about anything. Roxy, Alden, Abigail and Alex did a very good job especially the girl who was in charge of the Birthday, she was born to do the job she did. Highly recommended!

top_reviews.title: A wonderful holiday indeed
top_reviews.review: God bless their wonderful team. To be honest working in this kind of field is not easy but they handled it well with their smile and dedication. They are so welcoming and helpful . Our whole experience in Oli Oli is really amazing.

top_reviews.title: Great for young children!
top_reviews.review: My child & I visited on 21 May from 10.30am to 1pm. In every gallery/station, we were greeted by a friendly crew who was so patient in explaining the how-to to my child. In particular, the crew member at the colouring station interacted so well with my child. The activities are engaging, perfect for young children!

top_reviews.title: Oli Oli - A school's dream excursion destination!
top_reviews.review: Oli Oli offers an incredible opportunity for students to continue their learning journey outside the classroom. This STEM-integrated facility focuses on the holistic development of the child, fostering learning through play. The staff's warmth and friendliness make it a student-focused and well-maintained environment. We are grateful for the space it provides to make learning fun and interesting, and we highly recommend it to any parent or school. Our students are enthusiastic about Oli Oli, and we look forward to our next visit.

top_reviews.title: Amazing experience ð¯
top_reviews.review: We had an outstanding time at the OliOli Children's Museum! The various galleries that offer activities that kept our kids engaged and excited throughout our visit. The interactive exhibits are not only fun but also educational, making it a perfect outing for families. A special shoutout to Don, a staff member who went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable experience. His patience and enthusiasm as he played with the kids and showed us around made our visit even more enjoyable. The entire staff was friendly and accommodating, contributing to a fantastic atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone with young children looking for a fun and enriching experience!

top_reviews.title: Always exceptional!
top_reviews.review: We had a pleasant visit at OliOli! We usually visit on weekends but I would say weekdays are the best! They have the free food for kids for 3hrs play ticket! Cafe is a vibe, Mark is very friendly with the kids while we are on cafe and Don is the best! He helps us and guide on cars and ramps and that made our visit more special!

top_reviews.title: Fantastic engaging and immersive experience for young children
top_reviews.review: 6 Year Old absolutely loved her time at Oli Oli. Wonderful interactive and immersive experiences available. The staff are delightful, very engaging and keen to participate alongside the children - they are welcoming and friendly and put the children to ease. Spent over 3 hours there and could quite easily have spent many more. The range of activities is so simple yet so thought provoking. Well priced and a terrific indoor adventure to get children thinking and exploring in a safe environment. Thoroughly enjoyable - great value and entertainment.

top_reviews.title: Best place for Family!
top_reviews.review: If you are visiting Dubai or lives here in UAE, You should visit OliOli! I love how they had a different concept per room and they also have a small cafe with variety of healthy option for kids and adults too! Iâd recommend to bring socks as you will need it. This place is for families and for sure you will need lots of energy as you play with your kids! Iâd like to highlight their staff! Very helpful and friendly. We met the loveliest people in light room - Eliza and Don who play and guide us. That made our visit memorable and enjoyable!

top_reviews.title: Take a full 3 hours for sure!
top_reviews.review: My son couldn't get enough of this place after 3 hours of non stop, explorative play. Fantastic set up, huge place and well maintained yet quiet in September. Great value and he rated it 9/10 ahead of all the theme parks and waterparks. Wow.

name: Dubai Opera
description: In the heart of the United Arab Emirates, where cultures unite, Dubai Opera stands tall, as the main lighthouse for the performing arts in the Middle East. A global stage, where artistic languages, creative expressions, from all over the world converge and blend every day. Dubai Opera serves, unifies and inspires the community of Dubai and beyond. Through excellence in the arts, Dubai Opera aims to build a more vibrant and inclusive society, placing Dubai at the forefront of the global cultural scene.
getting_there: Burj Khalifa/Dubai Mall â¢ 9 min walk

top_reviews.title: Beautiful theatre
top_reviews.review: We have gone to see both the Nutcracker ballet and the Matteo Bocelli show at the Dubai opera. The Dubai Opera is a beautiful well organised theatre. Delightful staff and beautiful setting. We enjoyed both shows thoroughly.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful Venue
top_reviews.review: Felt like film stars arriving at the Opera House on 21st December to see Matteo Bocelli. Red carpet arrival and the venue is beautiful with views over the dancing fountains from the bar areas. Fabulous auditorium and would argue everyone would have an excellent view. We booked one of the boxes close to the stage and it was amazing! The bathroom facilities are lovely with a beautiful light fitting which looks like morano glass in the centre of the room with glass basins beneath, spotlessly clean. Would recommend and if in Dubai again will definitely be seeing what is on for another excellent experience.

top_reviews.title: A modern and sophisticated cultural hub
top_reviews.review: I came here for the second time and never got disappointed from the moment I stepped inside to those popular and international performances that I did not want to miss. I love the staff's friendliness, making you feel comfortable. The interior design of the place is worth staring at. It was indeed a wonderful experience.

top_reviews.title: Giselle did not disappoint!
top_reviews.review: Giselle a Ballet performed by the Polish National Ballet was showing for only two nights at the Dubai Opera so I took the opportunity to book this and a pre-show "Classic" package which was very well priced and started off an amazing experience to the Dubai Opera. Shown to the a private lounge on arrival and welcomed with glass of champagne on arrival, a private sofa and table in the VIP lounge as well as a tray of canapes to enjoy before the show. If booking at the Dubai Opera again, I would definitely book the Classic package again, 75 DHs extra was great value to start the evening off and feel special!

top_reviews.title: Over the clouds in CLOUD 22
top_reviews.review: The Cloud 22 infinity pool at Atlantis The Royal is a must-visit, situated high above the sky. The view is truly surreal, and the atmosphere strikes a perfect balance between relaxation and fun. During our visit, we enjoyed a delectable lunch consisting of lamb chops and baby chicken, as well as pizza and fries for our late afternoon snacks. The taste and quality of the food were top-notch, truly world-class! I want to give special recognition to Niken, whose exceptional service made our experience even more memorable. She took great care of us and ensured our comfort throughout. Niken's attentiveness and genuine care made us feel like VIPs. It was an added bonus to notice her serving everyone with a warm and welcoming smile!

top_reviews.title: SURPRISE ENGAGMENTâ¦ amazing staff, incredible view
top_reviews.review: I expected to be only on a floating bedâ¦little did I know my partner and management were in on a secret engagement for me!!! Management and staff went above and beyond for us and our special moment, couldnât have done better, really made it special, gave us a special fruit playter set up with my ring in the middle, we really loved this special touch. View was incredible, cleanliness was of high standard, staff were very friendly and approachable, I would say staff should be given chairs or regular water breaks as its so hot and they were standing for so long.

top_reviews.title: The Perfect Engagement Surprise with outstanding Staff & View at Cloud22
top_reviews.review: As a couple looking for a special experience to celebrate our engagement, we couldn't have chosen a better place than Cloud22. It was an unforgettable experience, with breathtaking views that truly captured the essence of Dubai's skyline. However, what made our time at Cloud22 even more exceptional was the outstanding staff, particularly Steffi, who went above and beyond to make our engagement surprise perfect. From the moment we arrived, Steffi and the staff greeted us with a warm and genuine smile, instantly making us feel welcomed and valued as guests. She went the extra mile to ensure that every detail of our surprise was executed flawlessly. Steffi's attentiveness and impeccable professionalism truly made us feel like VIPs throughout our entire visit. The service provided by the staff at Cloud22 was simply outstanding.

top_reviews.title: Amazing experience- Thankyou Daniela
top_reviews.review: Such a lovely experience, amazing food, good drinks and great atmosphere. All the staff at cloud 22 were so friendly and welcoming no complaints. Iâd like to say a big thankyou to Daniela for making me and my partner very welcome and ensuring we are happy sheâs very welcoming and positive and make our experience 10/10 would definitely recommend cloud 22

top_reviews.title: Incredible Views
top_reviews.review: Cloud 22 is absolutely worth visiting. The views are incredible. The staff go above and beyond. Everything is luxurious... you can easily spend all day in the infinity pool enjoying the Palm views, sipping on some drinks & enjoying the delicious food. Cabanas and sun lounge chairs are available for a fee. Cloud 22 is not complimentary even when you are staying at the hotel... but it's totally worth it Reservation is required.

top_reviews.title: An experience must tryâ¦
top_reviews.review: Top place with stunning view! Amazing pool and very nice and attentive staff. Very nice food and reasonable pricing for a venue like that. Wanna give credit to Damien , Vasilis and one lady for being so professional and made our day!

top_reviews.title: Heaven on earth!!!
top_reviews.review: The best rooftop pool in Dubai! Absolutely heavenly. I never I saw a place like that! Beyond words and luxuryâ¦ Views, food, staff and service were top as you expect in a place like that. Best option for infinity pool. I am still processing the experience we had in Cloud22. We will be back for sure, the best place I was in my entire life without doubt! Just WOW!!ð¤

top_reviews.title: Great staff and venue!
top_reviews.review: Exceptional hospitality from all staff but especially to Bayern and Zia. Both were attentive and caring throughout the day. So professional. They made the day more enjoyable, nothing was too much trouble. I have to commend their patience with the most ignorant of clientele. However I have to say great venue and all day vibes. Great first impressions and come away having enjoying the day. Thanks to all the team! Definitely will go back in the not distant future.

top_reviews.title: A truly special experience
top_reviews.review: A truly special experience right from the start. The staff are so welcoming and attentive. Would definitely recommend going for a floating bed in the infinity pool if you can - the views of the palm are incredible (most lose the sun around 4:30pm and our waiter did offer to move us but we were happy where we were). We didnât venture round the other side but I suspect itâs shaded all day and less of a vibe. The food was top class. Whilst not stared on the menu you can chicken or prawns to the Caesar salad. DJ ramps up around 1:30-2pm complemented by a violinist. We were struggling to decide between here & Aura but so glad we chose here - couldnât fault it one bit.

top_reviews.title: Amazing day
top_reviews.review: Amazing experience, beautiful location and surroundings. We had an infinity pool bed and so glad I picked this one as it had the sun all day long! Our server Tristan from South Africa was THE best! Took excellent care of us and a lovely young man to have a chat with. Would definitely come back again.

name: Museum Of Illusions
description: Welcome to our fascinating world of illusions. Thrilled yet bewildered you will enter a world that will blow your mind but also give you an opportunity to learn all sorts of things... come and visit us! It is sure to be an amazing and unimaginable experience because whatever you see, especially here in the Museum of Illusions, is not what it appears to be. Are you ready for an adventure?
category: Speciality Museums Science Museums Children's Museums

name: Al Seef
description: Along Dubai Creekâs shoreline is Al Seef, a bustling waterfront promenade where old meets new. It has two zones: an old-world heritage area and a modern section lined with malls, hotels, and restaurants. Here, you can learn about the Gulfâs beginnings as a famous pearl diving port, explore the open-air floating market and 1950s-style souk, get a henna tattoo, and purchase handicrafts along the sikkas (alleyways). You can even hop aboard a romantic dhow boat and take in the fantastic views on a dinner cruise. Al Seef is great to visit together with the nearby Al Fahidi neighborhood on a walking tour. â Tripadvisor
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Scenic Walking Areas

top_reviews.title: Al Seef, well worth a visit
top_reviews.review: Nice visit to Al Seef, recommended for seeing the old style buildings and shopping for bargains. Many places for food and drink, really good value. Great to stroll down the Promenade too and see a different side to Dubai

top_reviews.title: Lovely development
top_reviews.review: This is an impressive development on the creek. The development comprises an âoldâ dude and ânewâ side. The old side captures well the traditional building and streets of a classical Middle Eastern city. There are a large number of restaurants and shops, a museum of illusions and a couple of hotels. The whole area runs alongside the creek which makes further a beautiful backdrop.

top_reviews.title: Casablanca
top_reviews.review: Hotel is in a great location. I feel like I'm in Morocco n in a Indiana Jones movie. Plenty of shop n cafes right below our room. Room are small n have no electrical plus to charge phone from US ..so bring adapters..or ask hotel to bring you one..

top_reviews.title: Mirzam at Al Seef
top_reviews.review: MIRZAM Chocolate is must visit at Al Seef! Nestled in the vibrant streets of Al Seef, we stumbled upon this hidden gem of a chocolate store. During our visit, we had the pleasure of meeting the person behind the counter: Waseem, who exuded kindness and warmth. He patiently guided us through the array of chocolates, generously offering testers and sharing his expertise. We left with bags full of treats and hearts full of gratitude only because of him. Whether youâre a chocolate aficionado or simply seeking a sweet escape, this charming spot promises to satisfy your cravings and leave you with a smile. Thank you Waseem!

top_reviews.title: A Mixture of old & new Dubai
top_reviews.review: We are regular visitors to Al Seef when the weather cools down in the UAE. The redevelopment of the old Bur Dubai Creekside by Meraas is quite fantastic in my opinion. Inspired by the old Dubai architecture with sand stone and wind towers, they have changed the whole look & feel of this area. Ample parking in the lower levels, loads of eating joints of all types and the views across the creek are just fantastic! Definitely visit during the early evenings to around sunset time to get the best experience and experience Al Seef at night.

top_reviews.title: Reproduction of how things used to be
top_reviews.review: I do enjoy historical city centers, but this felt inauthentic to me. This entire area was built "in the style of" historical Dubai, and I did enjoy the scenery and the change of pace from the rest of Dubai. But I couldn't help but feeling that this was simply a veneer over an outdoor shopping mall. I stayed at the Al Seef hotel, which sprawls over a wide area, and I couldn't help but think that the idea was to locate the rooms so that you'd have to walk past lots of shops and spend lots of money.

top_reviews.title: Loved it
top_reviews.review: Al Seef and Al Fahidi are absolutely beautiful. Loved the alley ways in Al Fahidi. A must see on your visit to Dubai. Took an abra from Al Fahidi to the Gold Souk and it was a lovely experiece

top_reviews.title: Must Visit Place
top_reviews.review: An evening in the fifteenth century. Dubai, a symbol of innovation and human progress, is filled with modern marvels. Yet, amidst this contemporary landscape, Al Seef Street in the Al Fahidi neighbourhood offers a journey back to old Arabia. Stretching along the banks of Dubai Creek for one and a half kilometres, the street is divided into two parts. One side reflects modern life, with stylish restaurants and contemporary buildings, while the other side beautifully captures traditional Arabic culture and architecture. As you walk between these sections, it feels like stepping back four hundred years in time. Here, you'll find buildings made of sand, lime, and stone, narrow mud-brick streets, and weathered wooden doors. Palm bark canopies shade the entrances to homes, ancient fishing nets hang nearby, and the soft glow of lanterns enhances the historic atmosphere. Among these settings, youâll also discover various restaurants, including a Starbucks Cafe, designed in the traditional style. I spend my evening here whenever I get time, it is one of my favorite places in Dubai.

name: Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo
description: Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is one of the most captivating attractions in Dubai. Located at The Dubai Mall, the largest mall in the world, offering a memorable journey into ocean life. With capacity to hold 10 million litres of water, Dubai Aquarium is one of the largest indoor aquariums in the world and it illuminates the marvels of the ocean floor, showcasing one of the most diverse collections of aquatic life. Located just above the aquarium, Underwater Zoo brings visitors up close with penguins, piranhas, crabs, water rats, sea horses, jellyfish and plenty more. A fascinating new addition at Underwater Zoo is King Croc, regarded as nature's rare phenomenon and one of the world's largest reptiles - at over 5 meters long and weighing an imposing 750 kg plus. Underwater Zoo regularly hosts innovative exhibits. One such exhibit, 'UAE's Night Creatures' presents the experience of nightfall in the desert as creatures of the dark.

top_reviews.title: Varied experience
top_reviews.review: Purchase the outdoor penguins and inside penguin experience as well as the admission to the aquarium and under water zoo. The inside penguin experience was great they don't let you take your phone in and you have to purchase photos if you want them but loved it. The outdoor penguin experience was very poor in my opinion X2 glass small enclosures with perhaps 6 penguins in them, felt sorry for the penguins but they all look well cared for. Then the guide does a talk and shows you some other things. The underwater zoo and night zoo had lots of different fishes and species and was great. The downstairs aquarium tunnel was ok not that great,it got quite crowded but ok if you've never seen one of these tunnels before.

top_reviews.title: Great visit
top_reviews.review: Expensive, nice experience but I did think it was priced too high even for Dubai. The aquarium attractions are fantastic, you pay extra to feed the fish or visit the penguins. Itâs a great one off experience but due to the price would not visit again

top_reviews.title: Overpriced
top_reviews.review: I paid 410 AED (over 100 euros!) for an "ALL ACCESS PASS" bought online, a few days before the date of the visit. It's not worth it! The aquarium is quite big, beautiful, but I have seen other aquariums at least as beautiful for less than half of this price. The tunnel is short and trivial, Submersible Simulator is just a cartoon, Penguin Cove is a small section, with a few penguins that didn't look too happy. It took me two hours to visit it. All in all, it's worth visiting, it's beautiful, but it doesn't excel in any way and it's not worth the money!

top_reviews.title: Great marine experience
top_reviews.review: Ground floor has this giant fish tank where you could see all marine lives. I found the shark moving left to right and vice versa. Not sure if it was real or fake as didn't see his eyes blinking not even once. May be on some marijuana or something which kept them calm and move from here to there. Other fishes were live and playful. Underwater zoo tunnel was great experience. Then on first floor you have rainforest which is part of this ticket only. You get to see so many stuff there. Like all kinds of marines lives living in the water. Main highlight was big giant crocodile live infront of us in the tank. Rain forest was great experience. Even if you miss The green planet is fine as this was better than that. We had not booked for Shark experience & Penguine cave. Overall great place for kids to enjoy.

top_reviews.title: Okay
top_reviews.review: Some very interesting fish to watch and also some excellent animals and insects on the upper floor. What really let the place down for me and my wife was how you had to keep exiting the place to then go to another part of it then have to re-show your entry ticket. It was also extremely difficult to go around the place in a co-ordinated fashion - more signs would have been helpful. Personally been to better Sealife centres, but interesting nevertheless.

top_reviews.title: Just amazing!
top_reviews.review: Amazing staff. Very good value for money. The animals are very well cared for. I purchased the add-on for the otter, experience. I also purchased a diving experience in a cage to watch the sharks being fed. Everything was superlative. The briefing for the otters and the shark cage was very detailed and I could tell that the safety of the animals and myself was important to the staff. I was provided with a dive suit and diving helmet for the diving. I was allowed to buy a photo experience where the safety diver took tons of photos and videos and the staff then imported them directly on to my phone. The cafe was lovely and there were lots of nice options to eat. I was asked by several members of staff if I needed advice or if I had questions. I am absolutely in love with the otters. Shaking hands with an otter was the most amazing experience. I am going back later in the week to meet the otters again and to meet the penguins and the king croc.

top_reviews.title: Decent aquarium although expensive
top_reviews.review: This was a really nice and massive aquarium, they had so many types of fish including massive sharks, crocodiles, penguins and even reptiles and Manta Rays. It takes about 2-2.5 hours to do everything other than the diving. We did the whole package except diving, which costed 299 AED so itâs quite expensive. There is not really food inside, just a coffee counter with ready made sandwiches so best eat before or after. It is very crowded. Overall a good aquarium, not the best Ive seen in terms of aquariums in general, but worth a visit if you like fish.

top_reviews.title: Penguin cove is the best part
top_reviews.review: Walked past it loads of times and thought you could see it all from outside so why pay money to go it. Buy inside is much better going under the tunnel is great. Best part is the penguin cove. In the rest of the world you would pay 4-5 x the price of it to get a penguin experience, loved getting in the cold and seeing them up close. Very glad they provided the jackets to keep us warm.

top_reviews.title: Family Fun day
top_reviews.review: We recently visited the aquarium, the visit was organized by Fabio, and it was an extraordinary experience!.The staff was knowledgeable, and the ambiance was delightful. The diverse range of aquatic life showcased, along with informative displays, made it both entertaining and educational. Both kids & adults enjoyed the experience and clicked memorable photos. Canât wait to visit again ð

top_reviews.title: Penguin Cove. Azing experience!
top_reviews.review: Had an amazing experience at Penguin Cove. Our guide Jessica was very helpful. She explained and showed skark, jellyfish and sea horses Lifecycle. Gave us some nice facts about penguins. Worth it.

name: Illusion City Dubai
description: illusion City is a museum of wonderment. None of the elements in our collection can be described as ordinary, and many will defy your intuition and seem impossible. We have curated the finest examples from across the world, including carefully selected optical, auditory and tactile illusions, high quality magic tricks, the latest technological marvels, and even unbelievable phenomena found on the Internet. At illusion City, experience the impossible becoming possible, first hand!

top_reviews.title: Illusion city
top_reviews.review: Amazing little exhibition of illusions presented by a guide. Kids loved it too. Definitely worth a trip. Takes about 40min to go through depending on how much time you spend at each illusion.

top_reviews.title: Humorous family amusement with some learning moments
top_reviews.review: A quiet day wandering around Blue Water and came across Illusion City. Went in to see the displays. Was an interesting half an hour. We were escorted by a guide around a set of optical illusions. This was very helpful as she showed how to see some of the more complicated ones which you may not see on your own. There are lots of opportunities to take photos and amuse family. Was good value for money and a good way to spend half an hour.

top_reviews.title: Dont miss it! Wonderful place!
top_reviews.review: Amazing visit! Very original and so fun! We had a magical family moment, learning and taking photos ! The team was very kind and welcoming ! John was wonderful and Benj gave us Best tour ever! A must in dubai !

top_reviews.title: Mind-bending experience!
top_reviews.review: Sensationall! Wonderful experience and totally mind-blowing. I especially loved the ideas behind it, the physics, the angles, in shortâ¦..everything. Even my three-year-old son enjoyed it. As a school teacher I would certainly propose bringing students here. Bravo! Will definitely recommend to all my friends.

top_reviews.title: A must visit museum with kids !
top_reviews.review: Very interesting museum with illusionary games, rooms and sculptures to marvel at and make kids work their brain on. Beautiful pictures taken giving the illusion that my boy is climbing the wall like Spider-Man or making me so little compare to my kids â¦ lots of fun and good times ! I strongly recommend ðð»

top_reviews.title: Amazing experience
top_reviews.review: Not usually a museum type of person but this was 10/10. Very interesting mind blowing things. Very happy I actually went. Big shout out to John and the rest of the team for being so helpful. Definitely recommend.

top_reviews.title: Worth it!!!
top_reviews.review: It was a really fun experince. We were skeptical about it in the beginning but it turned out to be really interesting. Lukman, our guide was extremely amazing and very willing to take multiple pictures and ensure we have a good time. Highly recommend!!

top_reviews.title: Family time at illusion city
top_reviews.review: Has a chance to visit illusion city this Friday with my family we had a very good experience with its mesmerizing blend of cutting-edge technology and architectural wonders. The cityscape, adorned with vibrant lights and futuristic designs, creates a truly immersive illusion. From high-tech entertainment to stunning skyline views, Illusion City Dubai is a testament to innovation and luxury, making it a must-visit for those seeking a surreal urban adventure.

top_reviews.title: An amazing, interactive and creative experience! It makes you smile and have fun, so I definitely want to come back!
top_reviews.review: This museum is amazing! I visited it by myself and I really recommend you ask Justin for some guidance during the visit. He is very professional, friendly and has a great knowledge about all the illusions! Here you have an interactive and funny experience because you can try the illusions, see them and challenge your brain. You also take incredible photos and get surprised by each thing you see!

top_reviews.title: Have a fun hour â¦
top_reviews.review: Good fun to kill an hour. Awesome tour by John - taking crazy pictures. Some of the best money I have spent in Dubai. They really join you, show you the best camera angles etc. really good

name: Dubai Water Canal
description: Columbus Yachts and Boats Rentals was founded in dubai 2013 Cruise from Marina to Dubai Water Canal & enjoy amazing sightseeing along the Canal Route, Sheikh Zayed Bridge and more! 4 hours yacht cruise for 1 until100 people by Luxury Yachts
category: Bodies of Water Points of Interest & Landmarks

name: Dubai Marina Yacht Club
description: Set in one of Dubai's most vibrant residential areas Dubai Marina is spread over a 3.5Km canal. Comprising of 500 sheltered berthing spaces Dubai Marina is the largest Marina in the Middle East. A prestigious 5 Gold Anchor Award winning marina recognised for the quality of services and facilities. Also winner of Boat Owner Middle East Awards Leading Marina, 2013. Dubai Marina Yacht Club has become both a Waterfront Destination for residents and tourists alike and a Boaters Haven.
address: Al Hubob St Vida Dubai Marina, Dubai 32923 United Arab Emirates
getting_there: Jumeirah Lake Towers â¢ 4 min walk

name: The Green Planet
description: The Green Planet is the regionâs first bio-dome that recreates the enchanting world of a tropical forest with its rich biodiversity of over 3,000 plants and animals. The enclosed ecosystem, located at CITY WALK, offers visitors an immersive expedition into the tropics. The unique venue has 4 levels of interaction for visitor with fascinating animal and plant species to see from Sloths, Tucan's and Tree porcupines to South American plants, vines, reptiles, fish and insects. A great destination for families and guests of all ages.

top_reviews.title: Best birthday venue
top_reviews.review: We hosted my sons 7th birthday at Green Planet and it was AMAZING. The kids had a so much fun! If your kid loves animals this is an amazing place to visit. The best was Joy and Hershey who were so good with kids, so knowledgeable about the animals kept everything moving so smoothly. (Thank you ladies!) Highly recommend.

top_reviews.title: Worth doing but doesnât last long.
top_reviews.review: Great interactions with the animals and a fab concept. Would have given 5 stars but I was a bit disappointed that it wasnât a longer activity: we didnât rush through at all but weâre still only in the biome about an hour. There is a new play area outside but despite being covered it was still too hot for the kids to play for long.

top_reviews.title: Interesting place
top_reviews.review: A building in which a tropical forest is recreated, populated with many exotic animals and birds. The animals are basically domestic, they are not afraid of visitors at all and many of them walk freely among them. However, you are not allowed to touch them in any way, not even to pet them. During the visit, you can even witness the feeding of some of the animals. You can spend 1-2 very pleasant hours here.

top_reviews.title: Birthday party at Green Planet
top_reviews.review: Ms Hershie and Ms Franchelle did a fantastic job to host our daughterâs birthday party. It included a tour through Green Planet. The kids loved it. Thank you again for a great day

top_reviews.title: Beautiful planter
top_reviews.review: We visited green planet during our holidays in Dubai. It was really beautiful, surreal and interactive being here with all birds and animals roaming freely inside without being caged. We loved it here. One of the highlights of our Dubai holidays. Must visit if you have young kids with you.

top_reviews.title: Not for Disabled Persons
top_reviews.review: We had to leave the wheelchair behind as the place is not designed to hold disable people. Which you can figure out how our tour had to finish fast. The scenery is beautiful and very refreshing even to grownups. But tiny area to pass between crowds! Despite the above circumstances it is a great place for families.

top_reviews.title: Great Attractions for all ages !
top_reviews.review: My daughter aged 23 wanted to visit so we went as 4 adults ! This is a unique experience which I would say is a great place to visit for people of all ages. We did the complete experience in around an hour which was more than enough time for adults. If you have children below the age of 11 then it will take much longer as there are several play areas that will draw them in - activities in the attraction. You arrive and go up in the lift to the top of the building and then gently walk around the building descending visiting various habitant for different animal species. It unusual to be able to get so up and close to the birds which was a major advantage of this experience. There are two cafe / snack bars on on which is situated in the childrenâs play area.

top_reviews.title: Nature in its diversity
top_reviews.review: Truly a learning curve for children by observing and interacting with some of nature's wonders. The foliage, natural habitat, birds, animals and creatures were an eye opener for everyone including the grandparents!! Really a fantastic achievement in this part of the globe but not really surprising anymore seeing other theme related places in the same country. Nice short outing within the city limits.

top_reviews.title: Great Experience for whole Family
top_reviews.review: We enjoyed visiting the place very much. We could have spent the whole day here if we could. So much to see for a small place. We were just before the tropical rain and seeing the animal enjoying the rain was great. They have no care in the world, we felt like we were in the wild. Saw lemur âstealingâ the tortoise food. He went around stole every other animals food. Too funny.

top_reviews.title: Great up close experience
top_reviews.review: Great for kids and adults alike. The biosphere itself was an experience like no other. Better than any zoo. Getting close up with animals like you wouldnât get anywhere near else, particularly the UK. Itâs quite small and will only take around 45 mins if that, but well worth it for the experience. Only in Dubai would you get something like this.

top_reviews.title: Excellent
top_reviews.review: Really great and affordable way to get around the city. Surprisingly long ride from Dubai Marina to the Burj Khalifa and even further to the Gold Souk, but great value at c.Â£5 each per day (standard ticket) and c.Â£10 a day Gold Class. Definitely worth upgrading if you need a seat during busier times. Puts the London Underground and the Paris Metro to shame. Excellent!

top_reviews.title: Connects to the Major Attractions
top_reviews.review: We stayed near the red line and found it very convenient to get to where we needed to go and had planned for. There are a variety of ticket options and they cost 6 AED to 8 AED depending on the zone you are traveling too for a single journey. You can get a day pass for 22 AED that covers all zones and the tram line and we used this which we felt saved us a lot of money that would have been spent on Uber. There is a gold card available that costs twice as much and the seats are larger and the car is separate. There is also a separate car for women but my wife had no issues with the regular car until the evening when it was overcrowded but the women car also got pretty packed too. We rarely got a seat but found that the metro was smooth enough to stand on. The metro has plans to expand and hopefully soon as it seems near its limit most of the time for passengers. We were able to get on the first train most of the time but we didn't make it on once due to crowding and recall a few stations where people couldn't get on our train in the evening. The stations were easy to navigate but they could use more ticket machines during peak times. It is important to note that the metro only goes to DXB airport terminal 1 and 3 but there is a free shuttle that can take you to terminal 2. The metro is separate from the Palm Island monorail and that monorail has a pricey ticket. The metro is open until midnight most nights and 1:00 am Friday night.

top_reviews.title: Cheap way to get around - but not if you're claustrophobic
top_reviews.review: Fast and modern Metro system to see all the major Dubai points of interest. Buying a Nol Card is easy and can be reloaded as needed for fares. Mostly laid out on an East to West route (Red Line) and a SE route (Green Line). Stations are clean and signage is easy to follow. ***Note - the Metro is usually very crowded. Not recommended for people who are claustrophobic because the trains are congested with riders, especially on the Red Line during Rush Hours.

top_reviews.title: Excellent method of transport - if you are a woman!
top_reviews.review: Fast, cheap, well placed stations and everything you want from a metro (although overground, not a subway). However, like all big cities it gets uncomfortably crowded at and around the peak times. I was fortunate that, being female, I could enter the quieter Woman & Children cabins and most often get a seat even when a busy time. Would have been a nightmare otherwise. I do also like how Dubai metro stations with there large black/gold tunnels outside are very easy to spot even from a distance. Better than looking out for a small 'M' sign for sure!

top_reviews.title: Really convenient
top_reviews.review: Really easy to use and clean. If a female and travelling alone or with friends / children you can use the women and children cabins (no men allowed). Gets really crowded around rush hr but trains almost every minute

top_reviews.title: Loved it so much.
top_reviews.review: The first thing we did was getting the RTA cards and it's so convenient to use the metro. Can get very busy at times and that's something I love about the hustle. The stations and the trains are very clean and the stations have convenient stores too. Saves you a lot of time and money to get around Dubai. Very very convenient.

top_reviews.title: Good enough to travel along the shore line, but you'll need other modes to access inner city
top_reviews.review: It's the only metro available in the city. It's good to travel with, it's connected along the shore of Dubai. It has major stops around the entire metro line. It's a good initiative by the UAE Government to improve public transport

top_reviews.title: Great way to get around Dubai
top_reviews.review: This is a cheap, clean and efficient way to travel around parts of Dubai, including to and from the airport. The metro does get extremely busy around peak times so an upgrade to a gold ticket is worth it if you can afford it. It also offers great views of the skyline, in particular DIFC.

top_reviews.title: Way to travel as a tourist.
top_reviews.review: For tourists this is the best and cheapest way to get around in Dubai. Make no mistake the carriages can be packed at peak hours. Trains is on time and clean. Free wifi is also available on all trains.

top_reviews.title: Excellent metro service
top_reviews.review: With the metro I did visit the GITEX 2023 event in World Trade Center in the week of October 16-23. Very convenient metro line, which has a stop at World Trade Center right in front of the event. Leave your car at home and use the public transport to attend big events in Dubai.

name: Dubai Frame
description: The UAEâs latest cultural landmark, Dubai Frame is an iconic structure that âframesâ impressive views of Old and New Dubai, while serving as a metaphorical bridge connecting the emirateâs rich past with its magnificent present. Dubai Frame celebrates the story of Dubai from its early establishment to its ambitious plans for future development. Launched in January 2018, the project comprises a 150-metre-high, 95-meter-wide structure being built to resemble a huge picture frame, through which landmarks representing modern Dubai such as Emirates Towers and Burj Khalifa can be seen on one side, while from the other side, visitors can view older parts of the city such as Deira and Karama. Exterior design of Dubai Frame was inspired from the logo of EXPO2020 and it is world's largest picture frame by Guinness World Records. According to Dubai Frame general policy, guests are requested to wear respectful clothing: shoulders and knees to be covered.
category: Points of Interest & Landmarks Architectural Buildings Observation Decks & Towers

top_reviews.title: Great views
top_reviews.review: Neat, slim, high, perfect and simple architectural design. Not far from other attractions (Burj Khalifa, Museum of the Future) and reasonably priced fee at dhs 49 (USD 13.5). Less waiting time, and beautiful views from the top, specially to watch sunset. A one-time visit site

top_reviews.title: The Frame
top_reviews.review: Glad we did it. short and sweet, tick off the list of things to do in Dubai. Probably a âonce youâve done it, you wouldnât do it againâ type of place. Great views of The Burj and the forever growing city. Friendly staff and well managed queuing up lifts etc.

top_reviews.title: Great
top_reviews.review: I purchased skip the line tickets from a tour operator but did not receive them. The staff at The Frame were amazing! After explaining that they donât have fast track, they contacted the seller, sorted our entry and even let us go straight through. I canât praise them enough. The Frame is well worth a visit, we really enjoyed it.

top_reviews.title: You must visit Dubai Frame ð
top_reviews.review: Patience is a virtue when you are visiting Dubai Frame during peak hours, it was indeed worth the wait. We are queueing for more than 40 minutes just to reach the top floor. When reaching the top view, you will see the landscape of new Dubai and Old Dubai and you will walk on the glass bridge. On the top floor, we don't have family photos taken on our mobile at the glass bridge due to the big crowd, luckily there's a photographer who approached us to take a family photo... the photo was a bit expensive but worth buying for the family souvenirs. And the staff are all friendly especially the staff at photo souvenir they give us a good price to take home our memorable photos . I asked one of the staff regarding the best time to visit without that much queuing, he said from 9 to 10 AM and evening from 7 to 9 . ( Dubai Frame timings from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM) Overall it was an amazing experience. Highly recommended to visit.

top_reviews.title: Great experience my family really enjoyed â¤ï¸ððð
top_reviews.review: This 150 m building in the shape of a frame is a nice attraction to do in Dubai. For 50 AED, you get access to the top floor to enjoy a stunning view over the city skylines. There is also an entertaining opaque glass floor that becomes transparent when touched and give you a scare. Highly recommended!

top_reviews.title: Iconic Landmark
top_reviews.review: This has become an iconic landmark, besides the Burj Al Arab and the tall Burj Khalifa. Very popular attraction as well. It is either you come early or late to avoid long tourist lines. At the topmost you can have views of old and the new of Dubai. Visit can last an hour as staying longer might be a bore. Outside , look for photo ops ideal to your setting. It is my 2nd visit , and it is still fine with me.

top_reviews.title: Worth to visit
top_reviews.review: A very beautiful view of the city from the top of the frame. Never thought from the outside that people can go to the top of this frame and also walk looking directly below via a transparent floor. The area surrounding this frame is very well maintained and it's a good place to click beautiful picturespictures.

top_reviews.title: Definitely worth visit
top_reviews.review: Ticket was quick to get but there was a long queue to get inside. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Definitely worth visiting. If you are scared of heights definitely not one for you. Enjoyed walking on the glass and looking down amazing views all round.

top_reviews.title: Far better than the Burj
top_reviews.review: Whilst the Frame is not as high as the Burj Khalifa nor affords as good views, it is a fraction of the price and you will not have to wait so long to get in and it is not as overcrowded. We did have to wait in the queue for about 40 minutes before we walked through the UAE in the past mini history tour, but when you don't have a time slot booked I guess you Kind of have to expect this. Views were great from the top, transparent walkway was cool and it wasn't overcrowded. Unlike the Burj you can see outside from the lift as you ascend. The UAE future 360 show at the end was very cleverly done. Whole thing including queueing probably took about 2 hours. Very nice gardens etc outside. Easy to access off stop 15 on the Big Bus Tour.

top_reviews.title: The view from the top of the frame is very, very beautiful.
top_reviews.review: Very nice.. and organized.. and they deal respectfully with visitors. The view from the top of the frame is very, very beautiful. Entrance price for adults is 50 dirhams and 20 dirhams for children Its height is about 150 metres Entry is through Zabeel Park Gate No. 4

name: Burj Khalifa
description: Standing over 2,700 feet and 163 floors high, this record-breaking skyscraper in downtown Dubai is the tallest structure in the world. Burj Khalifa has several open-air viewing decks and swanky lounges which offer splendid views of the UAE and the Persian Gulf. The highest lounge is located at level 154, and there is even a hotel at levels 38 and 39. Designed by Skidmore, Owings & Merrill architects, this mixed-used development atop Dubai Mall is inspired by the Great Mosque of Samarra in Iraq. You might want to buy skip-the-line tickets or join a tour to avoid snaking queues at this popular attraction in Dubai. â Tripadvisor
address: 1 Mohammed Bin Rashid Boulevard Downtown Dubai, Dubai 9440 United Arab Emirates
getting_there: Burj Khalifa/Dubai Mall â¢ 9 min walk

top_reviews.title: Family viewing
top_reviews.review: We bought our ticket on-line in the UK and went for a viewing for the 124/125 floors for a time before 3:00 pm (?) because after that time the price went up. If you use public transfer to get to it and get off at Burj Khalifa/Dubai Mall metro stop, you should be aware that the station is about 10-15 walk away from the actual mall but the walkway is under cover with a/c. Buying our ticket in advance and arriving at the set time allowed us just to walk in with no real queues for the very fast, quite cool lifts. There lots of official picture opportunities there with artificial backgrounds put on them but at the cost of Â£50 for a photo I thought it was extortionate. At the top there are obviously lots of people doing selfies and taking pictures and I thought the viewing decks would be a bit bigger but you do get a great view of Dubai. There is a usual gift shop at the top with a very small , expensive drinks/cake place.

top_reviews.title: A sight to see
top_reviews.review: A great way to see the city although it would be more spectacular if it was a clear day (not that common in Dubai due to the haze). Well run and only took about 10 minutes in the line to get into the elevators and up to the 124th/125th floor. The 360 views of Dubai are a sight to see. Lots to see and buy at the top. A well oiled machine to get you up there. We used the Dubai Go City pass and that got us straight in without having to book a time. Well worth a visit.

top_reviews.title: Incredible views of Dubai
top_reviews.review: Absolutely amazing experience to see Dubai from above. Youâll get views of the incredible buildings, fountains below, the coast and vast dessert where construction is ongoing. It is something you have to try once in your life. It was even more special to do this on our honeymoon and my birthday. We did a sunset ticket which is more expensive but worth it when you get to see the view by dusk and night with all the lights. If you are scared of heights (I am), trust me when I say that it actually feels okay.

top_reviews.title: A must-see experience
top_reviews.review: One of the top things to do in Dubai. A wonderful attraction. Very slick with staff organising visitors so all runs efficiently. Be prepared for a wait at peak times (2 hour wait even in Autumn). Book in advance. We booked online and received seamless service. Photos can be pricey but itâs par for the course with similar experiences. Gift shop is well stocked. If you get the opportunity try the virtual reality experience it is hilarious

top_reviews.title: Fantastic VIP Experience!
top_reviews.review: We decided to book the VIP lounge at the Burj Khalifa - everything was swift. VIP lounge very welcoming staff, food very lovely. Photographers friendly and got some lovely photos. The viewsâ¦. Just wow! We chose sunset and this was a perfect choice. Thank you for our great experience visiting the worldâs tallest building!

top_reviews.title: Dubai from the top
top_reviews.review: Ticket to access floors 124 & 125 is dhs 149 (USD 41) if booked in advance, which is highly recommended. Nice views from the top (if you fancy concrete jungle), overpriced photo-services, and I would is say the entrance fee is exaggerated as well. The tower is in Dubai Mall with a fountain show that runs for 5 minutes with an interval of 30 minutes. Donât miss it since you are there.

top_reviews.title: The views are amazing but be aware of timings.
top_reviews.review: There is no denying that the views from the top are breathtaking. We decided to pay extra to go to 154, we booked for 5pm so that we could see the views in daylight then watch the sunset and see the Dubai at night. We thought we had booked, expensive but once in a lifetime, tickets. On arrival we joined the queues with everyone else - it transpires the online booking is merely a booking confirmation, you have to queue to get physical tickets. Once these were obtained we were given a VIP sticker denoting that we were going all the way up and shown into a side waiting room, where we waited, and waited. There was no information forthcoming and time was passing. Eventually our guide appeared and as we were lead through security and a myriad of corridors we were given the history of the building - all very interesting had we not wanted to see the views in daylight. Yes the lifts are very quick but it was nearly 6 before we actually made it to the top by which time the sun was already going down. For such an expensive and supposedly luxury experience the organisation and communication were very sadly lacking.

top_reviews.title: Great view
top_reviews.review: Took about 15 minutes to walk from the taxi stand outside the mall to the entrance and then about 30 minutes to get to the elevator. The view was good although a little hazy that day. We could see the funnel of the QE2 in the port, the sail shaped hotel by the water and the desert. Small shop at top was busy but when you go back down there's a much bigger shop at the bottom. We only went to 124125.

top_reviews.title: beautiful experience
top_reviews.review: Beautiful, stunning experience and very welcoming staff. we paid VIP and had the pleasure to skip the queue. the lift was amazing as well! once you get to the top floor, it was breathtaking, stunning view and amazing staff

top_reviews.title: Top of the world.
top_reviews.review: I was a little nervous about going up in a lift so high but my nerves were unnecessary as you really didnât feel the lift moving. Once at the top, well floor 124, the views were amazing especially as it was particularly clear. I would definitely recommend a trip up the Burj Khalifa just remember to buy your tickets in advance!

name: Mall of the Emirates
description: This massive mall has a mix of luxury labels like Christian Louboutin and midscale brands like DKNY. Itâs also home to hotels, restaurants, theaters, and the indoor ski resort Ski Dubai.
getting_there: Mall of the Emirates â¢ 3 min walk

top_reviews.title: Amazing Mall to visit
top_reviews.review: This Mall is huge and has so many shops you should find what you are looking for. Even an indoor ski field with chair lift. You could spend an entire day walking around this Mall. Lots of eateries on every level is a bonus.

top_reviews.title: Mall that Caters to Everyone
top_reviews.review: This is just like itâs counterpart the Dubai Mall , the difference is that it opened first , making it a little on the dated side. But the enormous choices that it offers , caters to every type . From fast food to casual restaurants, from low to high end luxury brands ( Dubai Mall has the edge on this one with its Fashion boulevard) . It has a snow skating amusement park , and even a huge Carrefour supermarket. It even has cinemas as well .

top_reviews.title: Very Nice Mall
top_reviews.review: This mall is quite grand with plenty of shops and things to do. My wife and I spent 4 hours here window shopping and looking around. The Ski Dubai is interesting enough and worth a quick look. The mall is well appointed and many major brands are here including quite a few good restaurant chains. The prices were pretty decent compared to other malls we've been to in the middle east. We also got a little sidetracked looking at Christmas decorations that were scattered throughout the shops. The mall is located on the red line at the Mall of the Emirates Metro stop. It takes a while to get around the mall but thankfully the signage is decent.

top_reviews.title: HUGE mall with over 600 shops
top_reviews.review: My 2nd time to this huge mall but the biggest highlight in my opinion is the penguin experience within ski dubai, yes expensive but if you love penguins this is the place to go. Besides that I don't think there's nothing this mall doesn't have under its roof. Direct stop off the metro. Make sure you give yourself hours.

top_reviews.title: Nice mall
top_reviews.review: A fairly large mall. The central part is impressive, with the dome on the metal skeleton. What makes it really special is the fact that it houses Ski Dubai, a place where you can ski in the heart of the desert. Otherwise, an ordinary mall, with dozens of shops of all kinds, the fast food area, restaurants.

top_reviews.title: Collectibles Paradise
top_reviews.review: NE is a collectorâs dream come true! The selection of rare items, such as the sheer selection of Bearbrick figures, is simply extraordinary. NEâs curation of these collectibles showcases a passion for unique and exclusive pieces. The store is a must-visit for collectors seeking treasures that stand out from the ordinary

top_reviews.title: Smaller than Dubai Mall
top_reviews.review: Mall of the emirates is smaller than Dubai mall, but you will enjoy yourself more in my opinion. Ski Dubai is located inside the mall as well as many restaurants and shops to keep you busy for ahalf a day. Definitely worth the trip.

top_reviews.title: Mall of the Emirates stands as an ultimate haven for shoppers!
top_reviews.review: Mall of the Emirates stands as an ultimate haven for shoppers! The incredible variety of stores, encompassing high-end luxury fashion to affordable options, electronics, and more, is truly astonishing. The mall's expansive, pristine, and well-maintained environment, coupled with friendly and helpful staff, enhances the overall experience. With a diverse food court offering various cuisines and numerous entertainment options, including the must-visit Ski Dubai featuring the possibility of encountering penguins, the mall becomes a fantastic destination for a comprehensive shopping, dining, and entertainment experience.

top_reviews.title: it's a must-visit spot in Dubai
top_reviews.review: Yesterday, I had the pleasure of visiting the Mall of the Emirates, and it proved to be a delightful experience. The mall boasts numerous brand outlets and a diverse food court offering a variety of cuisines, making it an ideal destination for quality time with family and friends. Undoubtedly, it's a must-visit spot in Dubai, especially following a visit to the Dubai Mall.

top_reviews.title: My 2nd favorite mall in dubai
top_reviews.review: Mall of Emirates is my absolute favorite mall. Mostly because it has Carrefour supermarket! Love everything about it. For fun family activities, almost everything is located within. Ski sites dubai, the Ice rink, food court, designer/luxury and ofcourse various discounts at all times. My 2nd favorite malls of now

name: LEGOLAND Dubai
description: LEGOLANDÂ® Dubai is the ultimate world of year-round LEGOÂ® theme park adventures for families with children aged 2-12. It will feature over 40 interactive rides, shows and attractions and 15,000 LEGOÂ® model structures made from over 60 million LEGOÂ® bricks. LEGOLANDÂ® Dubai will feature six themed lands - LEGOÂ® CITY, ADVENTURE, KINDGOMS, IMAGINATION, FACTORY and MINILAND - each unique in their design, entertainment and playful learning experience.

top_reviews.title: Must do if you are in Dubai and love Lego
top_reviews.review: Every place I travel I look for a Legoland near so when I went to Dubai I decided to visit place. And I love it, the mini city is breath taking, the attraction are fun, the installations are nice, I bought a lot of Lego's for me in the big store, the staff is really kind and welcoming. Totally worth it, sure I'll be back again!

top_reviews.title: Lovely
top_reviews.review: A five year relationship with Legoland dubai will never be a worth mentioning one. Special mention is ms tatu at the Legoland restaurant . A friendly person and smiling face. A feel good for every guest... Always would love to be here

top_reviews.title: Birthday Celebration at Legoland!
top_reviews.review: Because we stayed at Legoland Hotel and just after reviewing it, Ofcourse I'll review this one too! When we went here on October it was less crowded and everything was toddler friendly. We celebrated our son's birthday here and he had a blast! He wont stop talking about it and that only means that he had the best time of his life! It was our first time here and the tall dark gentleman at the entrance who's name started with letter K (I forgot to write it down lol) made sure that we're well informed about the timings and location of the rides. I love that he was very patient and took his time explaining the whole ordeal. We were lucky to say the least. All the rides were fun and spent our whole day there. We unexpectedly bought alot of lego pieces and that was expected because it was Legoland. 10/10 recommend and definitely coming back because our toddler keeps mentioning this place atleast 5x a day. Haha

top_reviews.title: Fantastic
top_reviews.review: We were really fortunate that we visited on a seemingly quiet day other then school trips so we walked onto pretty much every ride within a few minutes. It did feel if Iâm honest the shop/restaurant to ride ratio was really high.
